Package com.example.inventorymanager

Class TagTesting

java.lang.Object
com.example.inventorymanager.TagTesting
public class TagTesting extends Object
Conducts comprehensive UI testing on item tags. Verifies that tags can be ____ Tests US 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5 All tests should be run on Pixel 6 API 34.
Author:
Sumaiya Salsabil

    • addItem

      private void addItem(String Name, @Nullable String currentDateString, String Description, String Make, String Model, String SNumber, String EValue, String Comment, String tagText)
      Adds items through a function to reduce the amount of code duplication in testing.
      Parameters:
      Name - The name of the item to be added.
      Description - The description of the item to be added.
      Make - The make of the item to be added.
      Model - The model of the item to be added.
      SNumber - The serial number of the item to be added.
      EValue - The estimated value of the item to be added.
      Comment - A comment for the item to be added.

    • addManyItems

      private void addManyItems(int num)
      Adds multiple items to the inventory for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      num - The number of items to add. Each number corresponds to a specific item. For example, if num = 1, it adds a Gaming Headset; if num = 2, it adds a Gaming Mouse, and so on.

    • addManyItemsWithoutTag

      private void addManyItemsWithoutTag(int num)
      Adds multiple items without tags to the inventory for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      num - The number of items to add. Each number corresponds to a specific item. For example, if num = 1, it adds a Gaming Headset; if num = 2, it adds a Gaming Mouse, and so on.
